title: Calories in Water
meta_description: Discover water in calories: pure water has zero calories per serving, with full nutrition breakdown, equivalents, and tweaks for flavored variations.
assumptions: Plain, purified water at room temperature; no additives, flavors, or minerals beyond trace amounts.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by source (tap, bottled, mineral); additives like flavors or carbonation can change values. Check labels for enhanced waters.

quick_answer.text: Water contains 0 calories and provides essential hydration without macronutrients.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison; all values are zero for pure water.

faqs.q: How many calories are in water?
faqs.a: Pure water has 0 calories per any amount.
Plain bottled water has 0 calories; check for added flavors or minerals.

faqs.q: What about sparkling water in calories?
faqs.a: Unflavored sparkling water is 0 calories; sweetened versions may add 10-50 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: Can water have sodium or other nutrients?
faqs.a: Trace minerals like sodium may be present (e.g., 1-10 mg per 100 ml), but no calories or macros.

faqs.q: Why track water in calories for diets?
faqs.a: It's calorie-free hydration; ideal for weight management, but flavored tweaks can add calories.
